summary: the most common pathogen isolated was Adenovirus (49%), followed by Bordetella pertussis (41%) and Influenza-B (19.8%). the most common association was found between B. pertussis and Adenovirus (12.2%). the most common association was found between B. pertussis and Adenovirus (12.2%). clinical symptoms in hospitalized children with a probable diagnosis of Pertussis, positives for respiratory virus and atypical bacteria. cofections in hospitalized children with probable diagnosis of Pertussis, positives for respiratory virus and atypical bacteria.
